result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam N Inclan

Defendant Adam N Inclan in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is resolved.
Proper victim notification needs to be done.
BTC: Plea and sentencing date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam N Inclan in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Matter was resolved.
State has picked up a new charge.
State has revoked their offer due to the new charge.
Def is requesting an adjournment.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam N Inclan in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Parties are requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 28, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, MI (person, property, residence or family).  Third party contact must be used for contact with the minor child.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Adam N Inclan in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No amount given - victim information only
